class_notes:
This course will acquaint students with the style, mechanics, and appropriate rhetoric of oral advocacy in U.S. Court systems. Students will study the style and substance of oral legal argument, and how this style of oral advocacy may differ from policy advocacy or other countries' oral appeal to a tribunal. Students will visit courts to watch oral arguments. Working from a closed universe problem set, students will develop oral advocacy skills and practice delivering oral arguments for critique and review. In the experience, students will deliver oral arguments before a mock tribunal.
